origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Collection contains postcards acquired at various times by the Rubenstein Library at Duke. Collection is organized into three main categories--International, United States, and Miscellaneous. The International postcards are arranged by country and include cards from France, Italy, Canada, England, Germany, Japan, Spain, and Russia. The collection includes a set of early 20th century postcards from Thessaloniki (also known as Salonica and Selanik), Greece. The United States postcards cover many states, with large numbers from North Carolina and Virginia. The Miscellaneous category contains postcards with different subjects, including modes of transportation, food, tourism, agriculture, wars and battles, heads of state, flowers and plants, advertising, love and friendship, Confederate memorials, poetry, and animals. There are cards intended to be humorous, as well as cards depicting racist stereotypes and caricatures of African American and Native American people. Also included is a series of postcards with images relating to European artists.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Postcard Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Postcard collection was assembled by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library through gifts and purchases from 1939 to 2020.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing note: In April 2020 a file titled "Negroes, See also: Agriculture, Humor, or Southern Scenes" was removed and reprocessed. These cards are now filed under "People" and divided into two categories: "African Americans" and "Racist and Stereotypical Depictions of African Americans."

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains postcards acquired at various times by the Rubenstein Library at Duke. Collection is organized into three main categories--International, United States, and Miscellaneous. The International postcards are arranged by country and include cards from France, Italy, Canada, England, Germany, Japan, Spain, and Russia. The collection includes a set of early 20th century postcards from Thessaloniki (also known as Salonica and Selanik), Greece. The United States postcards cover many states, with large numbers from North Carolina and Virginia. The Miscellaneous category contains postcards with different subjects, including modes of transportation, food, tourism, agriculture, wars and battles, heads of state, flowers and plants, advertising, love and friendship, Confederate memorials, poetry, and animals. There are cards intended to be humorous, as well as cards depicting racist stereotypes and caricatures of African American and Native American people. Also included is a series of postcards with images relating to European artists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Acquired as part of Acc. 2019-0062: Ottoman Period postcards of Salonica / Selanik / Thessaloniki region of Greece.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Acquired as part of Acc. 2021-0004: 274 postcards of Salonica / Selanik / Thessaloniki region of Greece. Most cards are from the early 20th century. An unverified, detailed inventory can be made available upon request.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Advertising; Agriculture; Airplanes; Animals; Art; Automobiles.
